New Records: The Chicago White Sox tied the 1916 Philadelphia Athletics for the third most losses since 1900 with their 117th loss of the season.
Key Match Events: Jordyn Adams hit a walk-off single in the 13th inning to secure a 4-3 victory for the Los Angeles Angels.
Eric Wagaman scored the winning run in the 13th inning after Jordyn Adams' grounder deflected off the glove of third baseman Miguel Vargas.
The White Sox had the bases loaded with two outs in the 13th inning, but José Quijada struck out Yoán Moncada to end the frame.
Andrew Vaughn hit his team-tying 19th home run in the fourth inning.
The game went into extra innings tied at one, with each team scoring in the 10th and 11th innings.
Post-Match Reflections: Angels manager Ron Washington commented on the team's perseverance, stating, 'We had opportunities throughout the game to do something, we just couldn’t stretch that run, especially in extra innings. But we kept going and finally caught a break.'

White Sox interim manager Grady Sizemore reflected on the upcoming series, saying, 'We get the same question every day, we're focused on one series at a time and one game at a time. Everything else is irrelevant right now. It's going to be a hard series (in San Diego). They're playing for something and we have to play our best ball to have a chance.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox need to go 7-2 in their final nine games to avoid the post-1900 record of 120 losses by the 1962 expansion New York Mets.
The Angels had the bases loaded in the 10th and 12th innings but were finally able to walk it off in the 13th.
The White Sox have hit nine home runs over the last five games after recording just six in the previous 13 contests.
Others: Angels outfielder Mickey Moniak did not start for the third straight day due to a left hand injury but came in as a pinch runner in the 11th inning.
The White Sox will start LHP Garrett Crochet in their upcoming series against San Diego.
The Angels will head to Houston for a four-game weekend series, with LHP José Suarez making his second start of the season on Thursday.
